document_data.name: ''White rose ring''
document_data.mainbody: A '''''white rose ring''''' was an ornamental [[:category:rings|ring]] that served as a symbol of distinction in the city of [[Ravens Bluff]] during the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]]. This decoration was awarded posthumously to knights of the [[Knights of the Dove|Order of the Dove]] who sacrificed their lives to save that of an innocent. It was a merit that was exclusive to that specific knightly order.
